critique: The document pertains to the appointment of a member to the National Bituminous Coal Industrial Board in 1934, referencing the Code of Fair Competition for the Bituminous Coal Industry approved by an earlier Executive Order. Given the context of the New Deal era, this suggests government intervention in the economy. There is no information related to immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. The document seems to be an administrative action related to economic regulation during the New Deal era.
